时态注意：bump into（一般时），bumped into（过去式），have/has bumped into（现在完成）。
“bump into sb.”多指偶遇；如果强调“安排好的见面”，通常用“meet”而不是“bump into”。
etymology: “bump”原指“撞击、隆起的包”，19世纪起常用在口语中表示“撞到”；与介词“into”搭配后，既可指身体上“撞进某人/某物”，也引申为“意外碰见某人”。
mnemonic: 把“bump”记成“砰(碰)一下”，into=“撞进/走进”，合起来就是“砰一下撞进某人/某物”，也就引申成“突然遇到”。
联想：在路上“撞见”熟人——先是“撞到”，后是“撞见”。

summary.en: meet someone unexpectedly or accidentally hit them
summary.zh: 偶然遇到某人，或不小心撞到某人

definition.en: to meet someone unexpectedly (often by chance)
definition.zh: 偶然遇到某人；不期而遇

examples.en: I bumped into my old classmate at the supermarket.
examples.zh: 我在超市偶然遇到了我的老同学。

examples.en: Did you bump into Alex on your trip?
examples.zh: 你旅行时有碰到（偶遇）亚历克斯吗？

definition.en: to accidentally hit someone with your body while moving
definition.zh: 不小心撞到某人（身体碰撞）

examples.en: Sorry—I didn’t mean to bump into you.
examples.zh: 对不起——我不是故意撞到你的。

examples.en: It’s crowded, so people keep bumping into each other.
examples.zh: 这里太拥挤了，所以人们一直互相撞到。

extraExplanation: “bump into someone”有两种常见意思：1）偶然遇见（更常用）；2）不小心撞到。通常看语境：如果后面跟地点/时间（at the mall, yesterday），多半是“偶遇”。
口语里谈“偶遇”时，也常用“run into someone”。两者都很自然，但“run into”更常见一些。
etymology: “bump”原意是“碰撞、撞击”，来自表示“隆起/肿块”的含义延伸而来；“bump into”后来引申出“偶然遇见”，就像“在路上撞见”一样。
mnemonic: 把“bump”想成“砰一下撞到”：在路上“砰”地碰到人→也可以引申为“撞见/偶遇”。
联想中文“撞到/撞见”：英语里也用“bump into”来表达“撞见（偶遇）”。

summary.en: to kill someone or push someone out of a position (informal)
summary.zh: （非正式）杀死某人，或把某人从职位/圈子里挤下去

definition.en: to kill someone (informal; often used about criminals or secret plans)
definition.zh: （非正式）杀死某人；干掉某人（常指犯罪或暗中计划）

examples.en: The detective believed the witness was bumped off to keep him quiet.
examples.zh: 侦探认为那个证人是被人干掉的，为了让他闭嘴。

examples.en: In the movie, the villain tries to bump off anyone who knows the truth.
examples.zh: 在电影里，反派试图干掉任何知道真相的人。

definition.en: to remove someone from a job or position, especially in a sudden or unfair way (informal)
definition.zh: （非正式）把某人从职位上弄下去；挤走某人（常含突然或不公平之意）

examples.en: He says he was bumped off the project after the new manager arrived.
examples.zh: 他说新经理来了之后，他就被从项目里挤走了。

examples.en: Politics can be ruthless—people get bumped off committees all the time.
examples.zh: 政治很残酷——人们经常被从委员会里弄下去。

extraExplanation: 这是比较口语、带黑色幽默或犯罪色彩的说法；正式场合更常用“kill/murder”。
结构：bump + sb + off。宾语一般放中间：bump him off（更自然），但名词宾语有时也可放后面：bump off the guy。
etymology: “bump”原意是“撞、碰”，引申出“把人撞出局”。“bump off”在20世纪早期的英语俚语里逐渐固定为“杀掉”，常见于黑帮/犯罪语境。
mnemonic: 把它想成“bump（撞）+ off（出局）”：把某人“撞到出局”，极端情况下就是“干掉”。
联想中文网络说法“下线/出局”，对应 off 的感觉：bumped off = 直接让人“下线”。

summary.en: increase or raise; sometimes upgrade or move to higher priority
summary.zh: 提高、上调；也可指升级或提升优先级

definition.en: to increase something (a number, level, price, effort, etc.), usually by a small or moderate amount
definition.zh: 把（数字、水平、价格、力度等）提高；小幅上调

examples.en: They bumped up the rent by 5% this year.
examples.zh: 他们今年把房租上调了5%。

examples.en: Can you bump up the volume a little?
examples.zh: 你能把音量调大一点吗？

examples.en: We need to bump up production before the holiday season.
examples.zh: 我们需要在假期旺季前提高产量。

definition.en: to move someone or something to a higher position or priority (e.g., upgrade a seat; promote a person in a list)
definition.zh: 把（某人/某物）提升到更高等级或更优先的位置（如升舱、提高优先级）

examples.en: The airline bumped us up to business class.
examples.zh: 航空公司把我们升到了商务舱。

examples.en: Because of his experience, she bumped him up on the candidate list.
examples.zh: 因为他经验丰富，她把他在候选名单上的位置往前提了。

definition.en: to hit or push something so it moves upward or forward slightly
definition.zh: （轻撞/推挤）使……向上或向前挪动一点

examples.en: He bumped up the box with his knee to fit it onto the shelf.
examples.zh: 他用膝盖把箱子往上顶了一下，好放到架子上。

examples.en: Be careful not to bump up against the table.
examples.zh: 小心别撞到桌子上。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：bump up prices/rates/costs（抬价/提价）、bump up production/output（提高产量）、bump up the volume（调大音量）、get bumped up to first class（被升到头等舱）。
口语里很常用，语气通常比“increase/raise”更随意，带一点“往上推一推”的感觉。
etymology: “bump”原意是“碰撞、颠簸”，来自表示“撞击/隆起”的拟声或描写性用法；加上“up”后，引申出“往上推/往上提”，再进一步发展为抽象意义上的“提高（数字、等级、优先级）”。
mnemonic: 把它想成“bum(p) + up = 撞一下往上”：轻轻一顶，就“往上了”→ 引申为“提高”。
联想中文“顶一顶”：对着数字/音量/等级“顶上去”一点点，就是 bump up。

summary.en: accidentally touch/hit something, or encounter a difficulty or limit
summary.zh: 不小心碰到；或（比喻）遇到困难/限制

definition.en: to accidentally hit or touch something (often lightly), usually while moving
definition.zh: （移动时）不小心撞到/碰到（通常是轻微地）

examples.en: I bumped up against the table in the dark.
examples.zh: 我在黑暗中不小心撞到了桌子。

examples.en: He bumped up against someone on the subway and quickly apologized.
examples.zh: 他在地铁上不小心碰到了别人，马上道了歉。

definition.en: to meet a problem, limit, or difficulty; to run into an obstacle
definition.zh: 遇到问题/限制/困难；碰到障碍

examples.en: We bumped up against budget limits on the project.
examples.zh: 这个项目在预算上遇到了限制。

examples.en: As I learned English, I kept bumping up against new words I didn’t know.
examples.zh: 我学英语时总会遇到不认识的新词。

extraExplanation: 常见结构：bump up against + 名词/代词（a wall / a limit / problems）。
可用于字面和比喻：字面是“身体碰到”，比喻是“碰到困难/限制”。
与 bump into 相近：bump into 更常指“偶然撞到/偶遇某人”；bump up against 常强调“碰到边界、限制或障碍”。
etymology: 来自动词 bump（“撞、碰”），up 表示“贴近/接触到”，against 表示“靠着、对着”。合起来强调“碰到……表面/障碍”。
mnemonic: 把 against 理解成“顶着/靠着”，所以是“撞上去并贴着某个东西”。
联想“预算上限（limit）像一堵墙”，一不小心就“bump up against（撞到墙）”。

summary.en: “Bump-free” means smooth, with no bumps or uneven spots.
summary.zh: “bump-free”表示表面平滑、没有凸起或不平整。

definition.en: Smooth and even, with no bumps, lumps, or raised spots.
definition.zh: 平滑的；无凸起的；无疙瘩的。

examples.en: The road is bump-free after the repairs.
examples.zh: 这条路修好后变得平坦无颠簸。

examples.en: Use fine sandpaper to make the surface bump-free before painting.
examples.zh: 上漆前用细砂纸把表面打磨得平滑无凸起。

examples.en: This moisturizer helps your skin feel bump-free.
examples.zh: 这款保湿霜能让皮肤摸起来更光滑、少小疙瘩。

extraExplanation: “bump-free”是由名词bump（凸起/颠簸）+ free（无……的）组成的复合形容词，常用连字符。常见于产品宣传、道路/表面描述、护肤与剃须场景。也可写作“bump free”（不加连字符）但作定语时用连字符更常见：a bump-free finish（平滑的表面效果）。

summary.en: “Bumped” is the past form of “bump”: it can mean accidentally hitting something, meeting someone unexpectedly (“bumped into”), being removed from a seat/flight, or increasing something (“bumped up”).
summary.zh: “bumped”是“bump”的过去式/过去分词：可指不小心撞到；（bumped into）偶遇；（航班等）被挤掉/被改签；或（bumped up）上调、提高/提拔。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “bump”) to hit something or someone by accident, often with a light удар/knock.
definition.zh: （bump 的过去式/过去分词）不小心撞到某物或某人，通常是轻微的碰撞。

examples.en: I bumped my head on the cabinet door.
examples.zh: 我头不小心撞到了橱柜门。

examples.en: The car bumped the curb while parking.
examples.zh: 停车时车子蹭/撞到了路缘。

definition.en: to meet someone unexpectedly (usually in “bumped into”).
definition.zh: （常用于 bumped into）偶然遇见某人。

examples.en: I bumped into my English teacher at the grocery store.
examples.zh: 我在杂货店偶然遇到了我的英语老师。

examples.en: We bumped into each other after years apart.
examples.zh: 我们多年不见后又偶然碰到了。

definition.en: to be forced to leave a seat/spot, especially on a flight, because someone else has priority (often passive: “got bumped”).
definition.zh: （尤指航班上）因他人优先权而被挤掉座位/名额（常用被动：got bumped）。

examples.en: They got bumped from the flight because it was overbooked.
examples.zh: 因为航班超售，他们被从航班上挤下来了。

examples.en: I was bumped to a later train.
examples.zh: 我被改到更晚的一班火车。

definition.en: to increase something to a higher level (often in “bumped up”).
definition.zh: （常用于 bumped up）把某事提高/上调到更高水平。

examples.en: The company bumped up prices last month.
examples.zh: 公司上个月把价格上调了。

examples.en: He got bumped up to team leader.
examples.zh: 他被提拔为组长。

extraExplanation: 发音小提示：bumped 的 -ed 读作 /t/（因为 bump 以清辅音 /p/ 结尾），所以是 /bʌmpt/，不是 /bʌmpɪd/。
常见搭配：bumped into（偶遇）；get bumped（被挤掉/被改签）；bump up（上调/提高，也可指“提拔”）。

summary.en: “Bumpee” is a rare informal noun meaning the person or thing that gets bumped.
summary.zh: “bumpee”是一个少见的非正式名词，指“被撞到的人或物”。

definition.en: (Informal, rare) A person or thing that gets bumped; the one being bumped.
definition.zh: （非正式；少见）被撞到的人或物；“被撞的一方”。

examples.en: Sorry—I didn’t mean to hit you. You were the bumpee, not the bumper.
examples.zh: 抱歉——我不是故意撞到你的。你是“被撞的人”，不是“撞人的那方”。

examples.en: In the game, one player is the bumper and the other is the bumpee.
examples.zh: 在这个游戏里，一个玩家负责去撞，另一个就是“被撞的那位”。

extraExplanation:
“bumpee”不是常见标准词，更像是把动词 bump（撞、碰）加上 -ee（表示“动作的承受者/接受者”）临时造出来的口语词，类似 employee（受雇者）、trainee（受训者）。
日常英语里你更常看到：
- the person who got bumped（被撞到的人）
- the one who was bumped（被撞的那位）
如果你其实想查的是拼写相近的 bumpy（颠簸的；不平的），也可以告诉我语境我再帮你确认。

summary.en: “Bumpen” is nonstandard slang (often German-influenced) meaning to bump a thread/post to the top; standard English usually says “bump.”
summary.zh: “bumpen”是非标准俚语（常受德语影响），指“顶帖/把帖子顶到顶部”；标准英语一般用“bump”。

definition.en: (Internet slang, from German) To “bump” a post or discussion thread by adding a new comment so it moves back to the top and gets attention again.
definition.zh: （网络俚语，源自德语）通过发一条新回复来“顶帖”，让帖子/讨论串回到列表顶部以重新获得关注。

examples.en: Sorry to bumpen this thread, but does anyone have an update?
examples.zh: 不好意思顶一下这个帖，但有人有最新消息吗？

examples.en: People kept bumpen the post until the seller replied.
examples.zh: 大家不断顶帖，直到卖家回复。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) A misspelling or playful spelling of “bump” or “bumper”; in standard English, use “bump” (verb/noun) instead.
definition.zh: （非标准/少见）可能是 “bump” 或 “bumper” 的误拼或玩笑式拼写；标准英语中一般用 “bump”（动词/名词）。

examples.en: I think you mean “bump,” not “bumpen.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想说的是“bump”，不是“bumpen”。

examples.en: The car hit a bump and everyone bounced.
examples.zh: 车子压到一个颠簸处，大家都弹了一下。

extraExplanation: “bumpen”多见于德语圈论坛/社群的英语夹杂用法：德语里有人把英语“bump”动词化后再加上德语不定式结尾“-en”（类似“to bump”→“bumpen”）。在纯英文环境中不常见，正式写作建议用“bump (a thread/post)”。

summary.en: “Bumper” most commonly means a car’s protective bar (front or rear). It can also mean a protective pad/guard, or describe something unusually large or abundant (e.g., a bumper crop).
summary.zh: “bumper”最常指汽车的保险杠；也可指防撞护垫；还可作形容词表示“特别大/特别丰盛”（如 bumper crop 大丰收）。

definition.en: A protective bar on the front or back of a vehicle that reduces damage in a minor collision.
definition.zh: （汽车前后）保险杠；用于在轻微碰撞时减少损坏的防护装置。

examples.en: A truck hit my rear bumper in the parking lot.
examples.zh: 停车场里一辆卡车撞到了我的后保险杠。

examples.en: The bumper is cracked, but the car still runs fine.
examples.zh: 保险杠裂了，但车还能正常开。

definition.en: A piece of padding or a guard placed to protect something from impact.
definition.zh: （缓冲用的）垫块；防撞护垫。

examples.en: Put a bumper on the wall so the door won’t leave marks.
examples.zh: 在墙上装个防撞垫，这样门就不会留下痕迹。

examples.en: The moving company used bumpers to protect the furniture.
examples.zh: 搬家公司用了防撞垫来保护家具。

definition.en: Unusually large; extra full or abundant (often used before a noun).
definition.zh: 特别大的；特别丰盛的（常作定语）。

examples.en: We got a bumper crop of tomatoes this year.
examples.zh: 今年我们收获了特别丰收的一季番茄。

examples.en: The store is offering a bumper pack with extra items inside.
examples.zh: 这家店在卖加量装，里面多送一些东西。

definition.en: A short phrase used on a TV/radio program or as a slogan, especially at the start or end (e.g., “bumpers” between segments).
definition.zh: （电视/广播节目间的）过场短语/短片；（节目开头或结尾的）提示语/标语。

examples.en: The podcast uses a music bumper before the ads.
examples.zh: 这个播客在广告前会用一段音乐过场。

examples.en: They added a new bumper at the end of the show.
examples.zh: 他们在节目结尾加了新的收尾提示。

extraExplanation: “bumper crop（大丰收）”是非常常见的固定搭配：bumper 在这里表示“异常丰盛/远超预期”。多用于农业或销售语境，例如 bumper harvest（大丰收）/ bumper year（丰收年、业绩大年）。
在北美英语里，车上的 bumper 对应英式英语也常用同一个词；但你可能还会看到与之相关的表达：bumper-to-bumper traffic（车挨车的拥堵）。

summary.en: A bumper car is an amusement-park ride where you drive small cars and bump into others for fun.
summary.zh: bumper car 指遊樂園的碰碰車遊樂設施：駕駛小車並互相碰撞取樂。

definition.en: a small electric car in an amusement park that people drive and intentionally bump into other cars for fun
definition.zh: （遊樂園的）碰碰車；一種小型電動車，遊客可駕駛並故意互相碰撞取樂

examples.en: We rode bumper cars after dinner.
examples.zh: 晚飯後我們去玩了碰碰車。

examples.en: My little brother kept bumping my bumper car on purpose.
examples.zh: 我弟弟一直故意撞我的碰碰車。

examples.en: The bumper cars area was crowded on Saturday.
examples.zh: 週六碰碰車區很擁擠。

extraExplanation: 「bumper car」在美式英文很常見；也常叫「dodgem」或「dodgem car」（尤其在英式用法或作為品牌/老式說法）。
這類設施通常在金屬地板上行駛，車子由上方或地面供電，並用橡膠緩衝圈減少撞擊。

summary.en: an unusually abundant crop yield
summary.zh: 异常丰盛的收成；大丰收

definition.en: An unusually large and successful harvest (a very big crop yield).
definition.zh: 大丰收；丰收（产量异常高、收成特别好）

examples.en: After weeks of perfect weather, the farmers enjoyed a bumper harvest.
examples.zh: 经历了连续几周的好天气，农民迎来了大丰收。

examples.en: The bumper harvest of apples pushed prices down at local markets.
examples.zh: 苹果大丰收让本地市场的价格下降了。

examples.en: The region celebrated a bumper harvest and stored grain for winter.
examples.zh: 这个地区庆祝丰收，并储存粮食过冬。

extraExplanation: 这是英式与美式英语都常见的固定搭配，多用于新闻、农业、经济报道中，强调“超预期的产量”。
与“good harvest（好收成）”相比，bumper harvest 更强调“特别多、非常丰盛”，常带来价格下跌、储存压力等连锁影响。
etymology: 源自形容词“bumper（满满的、超出预期的）”，19世纪起常用来形容“bumper crop（丰收的作物）”。bumper 原意与“装满/溢出”相关，后来引申为“数量特别多”。
mnemonic: 把 bumper 理解成“爆满/撑满”：收成多到“装不下”，就是大丰收。
联想“bump（碰撞）”→多到“挤来挤去会碰到”，夸张记忆“产量爆棚”。

summary.en: a year with an unusually large crop yield
summary.zh: 农作物产量异常高的一年

definition.en: a year when the harvest is unusually large and successful
definition.zh: 丰收年；收成特别好的一年

examples.en: Thanks to steady rain and warm weather, it’s been a bumper harvest year for local rice farmers.
examples.zh: 多亏雨水稳定、天气温暖，今年对本地水稻农民来说是个丰收年。

examples.en: After several difficult seasons, the region finally enjoyed a bumper harvest year.
examples.zh: 经历了几个艰难的季节后，这个地区终于迎来了丰收年。

examples.en: In a bumper harvest year, prices may fall because there is more supply than usual.
examples.zh: 在丰收年里，由于供应量比平时更大，价格可能会下降。

extraExplanation: 这是英语里常见的农业与经济表达：丰收年往往意味着粮食充足，但也可能导致农产品价格下跌（供给增加）。
“bumper + 名词”也很常见：bumper crop（高产作物/大丰收）、bumper profits（利润大增）、bumper turnout（到场人数很多）。
etymology: “bumper”在这里表示“特别丰盛的、超出预期的”，最早用于形容“装得满满当当”的东西；后来引申为“产量很高的”。“harvest year”指“以收获为中心来计算的一年/收获季对应的一年”。两者组合成常见搭配，表示“丰收的一年”。
mnemonic: 把“bumper”联想成“满到顶、爆棚”：丰收年=收成多到“装满一车”。
记搭配：bumper crop（大丰收）→ bumper harvest year（丰收年）。

summary.en: A protective cushion that reduces damage or injury from bumps.
summary.zh: 用于缓冲碰撞、减少损伤或受伤的防护软垫。

definition.en: A protective pad or strip attached to a vehicle’s bumper to reduce damage from minor impacts.
definition.zh: （车辆）装在保险杠上的防护垫/缓冲垫，用来减轻轻微碰撞造成的损伤。

examples.en: The parking garage required a bumper pad on each corner to prevent scratches.
examples.zh: 停车库要求每个角落装缓冲垫，防止刮蹭。

examples.en: After the small collision, the bumper pad was scuffed but the bumper stayed intact.
examples.zh: 轻微碰撞后，缓冲垫被磨花了，但保险杠本体没坏。

definition.en: A padded liner placed along the inside of a baby’s crib, meant to cushion contact with the rails (often simply called a crib bumper).
definition.zh: （婴儿床）沿床内侧围栏放置的软垫，用来缓冲碰撞（常简称为床围/crib bumper）。

examples.en: They bought a bumper pad to match the crib sheets.
examples.zh: 他们买了床围软垫来搭配婴儿床床单。

examples.en: Some parents skip a bumper pad and use a breathable mesh liner instead.
examples.zh: 有些家长不买床围软垫，而是用透气网状床围代替。

extraExplanation: 在北美语境里，谈到婴儿床的“bumper pad/crib bumper”时，常会涉及安全讨论：不同地区与机构对是否使用、以及材料与安装方式有不同建议。购买或使用前可参考当地权威机构的最新安全指南。
etymology: 由 bumper（“保险杠；缓冲装置”，源自 bump“碰撞”）+ pad（“垫子；衬垫”）组合而成，字面意思就是“用来缓冲碰撞的垫”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：bumper=“碰撞缓冲的东西” + pad=“垫子”，合起来就是“防撞垫/缓冲垫”。
联想中文“防撞条/防撞垫”：用途都是“碰到也不容易受伤或刮坏”。

summary.en: A short-message sticker on a vehicle; also a brief catchy slogan.
summary.zh: 贴在车上的短语车贴；也指简短上口的口号。

definition.en: A sticker (often with a short message, slogan, or joke) that people put on a car’s bumper or other flat surface of a vehicle.
definition.zh: （通常印有简短信息、口号或玩笑的）车贴；贴在汽车保险杠（或车身平面处）的贴纸。

examples.en: Her car has a bumper sticker that says “Coexist.”
examples.zh: 她的车上贴着一张写着“Coexist（共存）”的车贴。

examples.en: I saw a funny bumper sticker on the bus this morning.
examples.zh: 今天早上我在公交车上看到一张很搞笑的车贴。

definition.en: A very short, catchy political or advertising slogan—something designed to be remembered quickly.
definition.zh: （比喻）一句非常短、容易记住的宣传口号（常用于政治或广告）。

examples.en: The speech had real ideas, not just bumper-sticker phrases.
examples.zh: 这篇演讲有真正的观点，而不只是“车贴式”的口号。

examples.en: We need a plan, not a bumper sticker.
examples.zh: 我们需要的是方案，不是一句口号。

extraExplanation: 在美国文化里，车贴常用来表达政治立场、宗教信仰、环保理念、学校/社团认同，或单纯开玩笑；有时也会引发争议或刻板印象。
写作中说“bumper-sticker slogan/logic”通常带一点贬义，意思是“过于简单化、只会喊口号”。
etymology: 由“bumper（保险杠）+ sticker（贴纸）”组成。20世纪美国汽车文化中流行起来，用车贴表达观点、幽默或身份认同。
mnemonic: 拆开记：bumper=保险杠，sticker=贴纸 → 贴在保险杠上的贴纸。
联想中文“车尾标语/车贴”，通常就一句话，像“口号”一样短。

summary.en: Very heavy traffic with cars closely packed; also used for all-inclusive auto coverage.
summary.zh: 车挨车的严重拥堵；也可指较全面的汽车保障/保修。

definition.en: (Of traffic) moving very slowly or stopped because the road is extremely crowded.
definition.zh: （指交通）非常拥堵，车挨车地缓慢行驶或几乎不动。

examples.en: We were stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic on the highway.
examples.zh: 我们被困在高速公路车挨车的拥堵里。

examples.en: The accident caused bumper-to-bumper delays for miles.
examples.zh: 那起事故导致好几英里都是车挨车的延误。

examples.en: Try leaving earlier to avoid bumper-to-bumper congestion during rush hour.
examples.zh: 尽量早点出发，避开高峰期车挨车的拥堵。

definition.en: A type of insurance that covers damage to a car in many situations (commonly said as “bumper-to-bumper coverage”).
definition.zh: （保险）较全面的车辆保障（常说“bumper-to-bumper coverage”，意为从车头到车尾都保，口语指较全险）。

examples.en: This plan includes bumper-to-bumper coverage for the first three years.
examples.zh: 这个方案在前三年提供较全面的保障。

examples.en: Ask what isn’t included in the bumper-to-bumper warranty.
examples.zh: 问清楚这份“从头到尾”保修不包含哪些项目。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：bumper-to-bumper traffic（车挨车的交通）、bumper-to-bumper jam（严重堵车）、bumper-to-bumper coverage/warranty（较全面的保障/保修）。
写法通常带连字符（bumper-to-bumper），作形容词用；在名词短语里也常见：bumper-to-bumper traffic。
etymology: 来自汽车术语：bumper（保险杠）+ to + bumper（保险杠），字面是“保险杠挨着保险杠”，引申为“车挨车的拥堵”。后来也被借用来形容“覆盖范围很全面”的保修/保险。
mnemonic: 把画面记成“前车的保险杠（bumper）贴着后车的保险杠（bumper）”→ 车挨车、很堵。
联想中文“顶到保险杠了”= 距离极近 → 拥堵或“从头到尾都覆盖”的保修。

summary.en: “Bumpered” usually means “equipped with bumpers” (like a car or a bowling lane).
summary.zh: “bumpered”通常指“装有保险杠/缓冲装置的”（如汽车或保龄球球道）。

definition.en: equipped with a bumper or bumpers; protected by bumpers.
definition.zh: 装有（防撞）保险杠的；有防护缓冲装置的。

examples.en: The old truck is still drivable, but it’s not fully bumpered in the back.
examples.zh: 那辆旧卡车还能开，但后面没有完整装上保险杠。

examples.en: For beginner bowling nights, the lanes are bumpered so the ball doesn’t roll into the gutter.
examples.zh: 新手保龄球之夜会把球道加上挡沟边（bumper），这样球就不会掉进沟里。

definition.en: (rare/old-fashioned) having been struck or jolted; bumped.
definition.zh: （罕见/较旧用法）被撞过的；被颠簸到的。

examples.en: After the rough ride, the suitcase looked a bit bumpered.
examples.zh: 经历那段颠簸的路后，行李箱看起来有点被撞得凹凸不平。

extraExplanation: “bumpered”来自名词/动词“bumper / bump”。最常见的理解是“装有保险杠/缓冲装置”。在北美语境里，你常会在汽车（bumper 保险杠）和保龄球（bumpers 挡沟边）这两类场景看到相关用法。
“bumper”在较旧的英语里还可以指“满杯酒/祝酒词”（a bumper），因此历史上也出现过与“满满的、很大的”相关的引申义；不过“bumpered”按这种意思使用较少见。

summary.en: A bumperette is a small protective bumper piece on a vehicle, often at the corners.
summary.zh: bumperette 指车辆上的小型防撞保险杠部件，常安装在角部以防轻微刮碰。

definition.en: a small bumper or protective pad on a vehicle, often placed at the corners to prevent minor damage when parking
definition.zh: （车辆的）小型保险杠；（多指角部的）防撞块/防擦垫，用于停车时防止轻微刮碰

examples.en: The old sedan had bumperettes on the rear corners to protect it during parking.
examples.zh: 那辆旧轿车后角装有小型防撞块，用来在停车时保护车身。

examples.en: A light tap left a mark on the bumperette, but the body panel was fine.
examples.zh: 轻轻一碰在防撞块上留下了痕迹，但车身钣金没有受损。

extraExplanation: “bumperette”常见于汽车语境，尤其是较老车型或复古改装中：它通常是装在前后角部的短小金属件或橡胶垫，用来应对低速、轻微的擦碰。英语里后缀“-ette”常带有“更小/小型”的意思（如 kitchen → kitchenette），因此 bumperette 可理解为“较小的 bumper（保险杠）”。

summary.en: “Bumpering” usually means repeatedly bumping/knocking into something (rarely: adding a bumper or protective padding).
summary.zh: “bumpering”通常指反复碰撞/颠簸（少见时也可指加装保险杠或防护垫）。

definition.en: (Gerund/present participle of “bumper/bump”) hitting or knocking something so it jolts, moves suddenly, or collides.
definition.zh: （“bumper/bump”的动名词/现在分词）指撞击、碰撞，使某物突然晃动、移动或相撞。

examples.en: The carts kept bumpering into each other in the narrow aisle.
examples.zh: 在狭窄的过道里，购物车一直互相碰撞。

examples.en: I woke up when the bus started bumpering along the rough road.
examples.zh: 公交车在颠簸的路上一路颠撞时，我被震醒了。

examples.en: Be careful—you’re bumpering the table and spilling the drinks.
examples.zh: 小心点——你在撞桌子，把饮料都弄洒了。

definition.en: (Rare/nonstandard) putting a bumper on something, or adding padding/protection like a bumper.
definition.zh: （少见/非标准用法）给某物装上保险杠，或加上类似保险杠的缓冲/防护。

examples.en: They’re bumpering the new carts to protect the walls.
examples.zh: 他们在给新推车加装防撞条，以保护墙面。

examples.en: The workshop spent the afternoon bumpering the equipment for shipping.
examples.zh: 车间花了一下午给设备加防护，以便运输。

extraExplanation: “bumpering”在现代英语里不算常见；很多时候人们会用更自然的说法，比如：bumping（碰撞/撞到）、jostling（推搡/挤来挤去）、bouncing along（一路颠簸）。
如果你是在文章里看到“bumpering”，它常带有拟声和画面感：强调反复、小幅度但明显的碰撞或颠簸。

summary.en: Bumpers are usually protective bars on vehicles, and more generally any protective pads/blocks that cushion impact; in bowling, they are side rails for beginners.
summary.zh: bumpers 通常指汽车的保险杠；也可泛指用于缓冲、防撞的挡块/垫；在保龄球中指防沟边栏。

definition.en: Protective bars on the front and/or back of a vehicle, designed to reduce damage in small collisions.
definition.zh: （汽车前后）保险杠；用于在轻微碰撞时减少损坏的防护杆。

examples.en: The back bumper is scratched from a minor accident.
examples.zh: 后保险杠因为一次小事故被刮花了。

examples.en: The mechanic replaced both bumpers after the crash.
examples.zh: 事故后，修理工更换了前后两个保险杠。

definition.en: Protective edges, pads, or blocks used to stop or cushion movement on machines, doors, furniture, or playground equipment.
definition.zh: （机器、门、家具、游乐设施等的）缓冲挡块；防撞垫；用于减震或防止撞击的装置。

examples.en: Rubber bumpers on the door keep it from hitting the wall.
examples.zh: 门上的橡胶缓冲块能防止门撞到墙。

examples.en: The washing machine has bumpers to reduce vibration.
examples.zh: 洗衣机有缓冲装置来减少震动。

definition.en: In bowling, side rails that help keep the ball from rolling into the gutter (often used for beginners).
definition.zh: （保龄球）防沟边栏；帮助球不滚进沟里（常给初学者使用）。

examples.en: The kids used bumpers so they could hit more pins.
examples.zh: 孩子们用了防沟边栏，这样更容易击中球瓶。

examples.en: Can you put the bumpers up for lane 3?
examples.zh: 你能把3号球道的防沟边栏升起来吗？

extraExplanation:
“bumper”也常出现在固定搭配里：
- “bumper-to-bumper traffic” 指“车挨车的拥堵交通”。
- “bumper crop” 指“丰收；大丰收”（这里 bumper 作形容词，表示“特别多/特别大”）。

summary.en: “bumph” (more commonly spelled “bumf”) means annoying or unnecessary paperwork; in older slang, it can mean toilet paper.
summary.zh: “bumph”（更常见拼写为“bumf”）指令人厌烦或多余的繁琐公文/文件；较旧俚语中也可指厕纸。

definition.en: (BrE, informal) Paperwork or official documents, especially when they seem unnecessary or boring; bureaucratic “red tape.”
definition.zh: （英式口语）繁琐的文件/公文材料，尤指让人觉得多余、无聊的官僚文书（类似“官样文章/繁文缛节”）。

examples.en: I spent the whole morning filling out insurance bumph.
examples.zh: 我整个上午都在填保险的那堆繁琐表格。

examples.en: There’s so much bumph for a simple request.
examples.zh: 这么简单的请求却要一大堆官僚文件。

definition.en: (Older slang) Toilet paper or waste paper.
definition.zh: （较旧的俚语）厕纸；废纸。

examples.en: In older writing, “bumph” could mean toilet paper.
examples.zh: 在较老的文字里，“bumph”有时指厕纸。

extraExplanation: “bumph”常被视为“bumf”的变体拼写；现代更常见的是英式拼写“bumf”。
词源上常被解释为来自“bum-fodder”（粗俗说法，意为“擦屁股的纸”），后来引申为“让人厌烦的一堆纸”，再进一步指代“繁琐公文/文书”。
使用场景：多见于英式英语口语或非正式写作；在正式场合建议用“paperwork / bureaucracy / red tape”。

summary.en: “Bumphs” means boring or unnecessary paperwork and documents.
summary.zh: “bumphs”指（常被认为无聊或多余的）文件、表格等繁琐文书工作。

definition.en: papers, forms, and other routine documents (often seen as boring or unnecessary); paperwork.
definition.zh: （常指无聊或多余的）文件材料、表格等；繁琐的文书工作。

examples.en: I spent the whole afternoon filling out bumphs for the visa application.
examples.zh: 我整个下午都在为签证申请填写一堆繁琐的表格文件。

examples.en: The new policy created even more bumphs for the staff.
examples.zh: 新政策让员工要处理的文书材料更多了。

examples.en: Could you sort these bumphs into “urgent” and “later”?
examples.zh: 你能把这些文件分成“紧急”和“以后再说”两类吗？

extraExplanation: “bumphs”是“bumph”的复数形式；“bumph/bumf”多见于英式英语，语气较口语、带点吐槽，常用来指各种官僚式的表格、文件、手续。
词源上常被认为来自俚语“bumf”（原指厕纸/擦屁股用的纸），后来引申为“没啥用的一堆纸”，所以带有“废纸/累赘”的感觉。

summary.en: “Bumpier” means more uneven or more jarring than something else.
summary.zh: “bumpier”表示“更颠簸、更不平坦（比……更）”。

definition.en: Comparative form of “bumpy”: having more bumps, jolts, or unevenness than something else; less smooth.
definition.zh: “bumpy”的比较级：比另一个更颠簸/更崎岖/更不平坦；不那么平滑。

examples.en: This road is bumpier than the highway.
examples.zh: 这条路比高速公路更颠簸。

examples.en: The boat ride got bumpier when the wind picked up.
examples.zh: 风变大后，坐船变得更颠。

examples.en: The surface feels bumpier after the paint dried.
examples.zh: 油漆干了以后，表面摸起来更不平了。

extraExplanation: “bumpier”是形容词“bumpy”的比较级，常用结构是“A is bumpier than B”。最高级是“bumpiest”。
它既可以形容真实的路况/水面（physical），也可以比喻经历更不顺、更波折（a bumpier process/journey）。

summary.en: “Bumpiest” means the most bumpy—very rough or uneven, especially describing a road, ride, or landing.
summary.zh: “bumpiest”表示“最颠簸/最凹凸不平的”，常用来形容道路、旅程或降落等很不平稳。

definition.en: Having the most bumps; very uneven or rough in texture or movement (superlative of “bumpy”).
definition.zh: 最颠簸的；最凹凸不平的（“bumpy”的最高级）。

examples.en: This is the bumpiest road in the area, so drive slowly.
examples.zh: 这是这一带最颠簸的路，所以慢点开。

examples.en: The bus ride was bumpiest near the construction site.
examples.zh: 公交车在施工路段附近最颠簸。

examples.en: It was the bumpiest landing I’ve ever experienced.
examples.zh: 那是我经历过最颠簸的一次降落。

extraExplanation: “bumpiest”是形容词“bumpy（颠簸的、凹凸不平的）”的最高级。常见结构：the bumpiest + 名词（如：the bumpiest ride/road/part）。
既可形容“表面不平”（a bumpiest surface），也常用来形容“行程很颠”（a bumpiest ride/flight）。口语里常用来强调体验不舒服或不顺。
比较级与最高级：bumpy → bumpier → bumpiest。也可用更口语的加强表达：really/so/very bumpy，但“bumpiest”强调“在一组里最……”。

summary.en: Bumpily means “with lots of bumps or jolts,” and it can also describe something that goes forward in a difficult, uneven way.
summary.zh: bumpily 表示“颠簸地、一路震动地”，也可引申为“进展坎坷、不顺利地”。

definition.en: In a way that is rough or uneven, with many jolts or small sudden movements.
definition.zh: 颠簸地；崎岖不平地（一路有很多震动或突然的晃动）。

examples.en: The bus moved bumpily down the broken road.
examples.zh: 公交车在破损的路上颠簸地前行。

examples.en: The boat traveled bumpily in the strong waves.
examples.zh: 小船在大浪中颠簸地航行。

definition.en: In a way that progresses with difficulty, full of problems or sudden changes.
definition.zh: 坎坷地；不顺利地（进展充满困难、波折或突然变化）。

examples.en: Their relationship went bumpily at first, but it improved over time.
examples.zh: 他们的关系一开始进展很坎坷，但后来逐渐好转。

examples.en: The project continued bumpily because the plans kept changing.
examples.zh: 由于计划不断变动，项目推进得很不顺利。

summary.en: Bumpiness means the quality of being bumpy—uneven or rough; it can also describe minor difficulties or ups and downs in a process.
summary.zh: bumpiness 表示“凹凸不平、颠簸”的特征；也可比喻过程中的小波折和起伏。

definition.en: The quality of having many bumps; an uneven, rough surface or texture.
definition.zh: 凹凸不平；有很多凸起的状态；表面不平整、粗糙的特征。

examples.en: The bumpiness of the road made the bus ride uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 路面的凹凸不平让公交车坐起来很不舒服。

examples.en: I can feel the bumpiness on the wall where the paint wasn’t smooth.
examples.zh: 我能摸到墙上漆没刷匀的地方，表面有些起伏不平。

definition.en: A rough or difficult quality in an experience or process; ups and downs.
definition.zh: （经历或过程中的）波折、不顺；起伏。

examples.en: There was some bumpiness at the start of the project, but things got better later.
examples.zh: 项目一开始有些波折，但后来就好起来了。

examples.en: Moving to a new country can come with bumpiness as you adapt.
examples.zh: 搬到一个新国家生活，适应过程中可能会遇到一些不顺和起伏。

extraExplanation: bumpiness 来自形容词 bumpy（颠簸的、坑坑洼洼的）+ 名词后缀 -ness，表示“……的性质/状态”。常见搭配有 the bumpiness of the road/ride/surface（路面/旅程/表面的颠簸或不平）。
在比喻用法里，bumpiness 常指“进展不顺、过程不平滑”，语气通常比 serious problems 更轻一些，强调“有点磕磕绊绊但还能继续”。

summary.en: “Bumping” usually means accidentally hitting/touching something, moving with jolts, or (slang) music that’s loud and energetic.
summary.zh: “Bumping”通常指不小心碰撞、颠簸前行；俚语中也可形容音乐很嗨、很带劲。

definition.en: (present participle of “bump”) touching or hitting something (often by accident), usually not very hard.
definition.zh: （动词 bump 的现在分词）碰到、撞到（多为无意），通常不太用力。

examples.en: Sorry—I kept bumping into people in the crowded subway.
examples.zh: 抱歉——地铁太挤了，我一直不小心撞到别人。

examples.en: Be careful not to go bumping into the table; there’s hot soup on it.
examples.zh: 小心别撞到桌子，上面有热汤。

definition.en: moving in a way that causes repeated light knocks or jolts (because the surface is uneven).
definition.zh: （因路面不平等导致）一路颠簸、不断轻微碰撞/震动地移动。

examples.en: The bus was bumping along the dirt road.
examples.zh: 公交车在土路上颠簸前行。

examples.en: We went bumping over potholes all the way home.
examples.zh: 回家的路上一路都在坑洼里颠簸。

definition.en: (slang) loud, energetic, and enjoyable—especially about music.
definition.zh: （俚语）很带劲、很嗨的（尤指音乐很炸、很有节奏）。

examples.en: They were playing bumping music at the party.
examples.zh: 派对上放着很嗨的音乐。

examples.en: This beat is bumping.
examples.zh: 这个节奏太带劲了。

definition.en: (in phrases) increasing something, often slightly (e.g., “bumping up” the price/number).
definition.zh: （用于短语）提高、增加（通常是小幅度；如 bump up 价格/数量）。

examples.en: The store is bumping up prices this weekend.
examples.zh: 这家店这周末要涨价。

examples.en: Can you bump up the meeting to 3 p.m.?
examples.zh: 你能把会议时间提前到下午三点吗？

extraExplanation: “bumping”常见于搭配：bump into（偶遇/撞上）、bump up（小幅提高/提前）、bump along（颠簸前行）。学习时把它当作“bump”的动作正在发生，会更好理解。
口语里形容音乐“bumping”，多指低音很重、节奏很强、气氛很嗨；更正式可用 energetic / upbeat / lively。

summary.en: “Bumpingly” means “in a bumpy, jolting way,” and sometimes “awkwardly, bumping into things.”
summary.zh: “bumpingly”表示“颠簸地、一路震动地”，有时也指“笨拙地、磕磕碰碰地”。

definition.en: In a way that is bumpy, with repeated small jolts or bumps.
definition.zh: 颠簸地；一路有许多小震动地。

examples.en: The bus moved bumpingly over the potholes.
examples.zh: 公交车经过坑洞时颠簸前行。

examples.en: We rode bumpingly along the old dirt road.
examples.zh: 我们在旧土路上颠簸地行驶。

definition.en: (Less common) In an awkward or clumsy way, as if bumping into things.
definition.zh: （较少见）笨拙地；磕磕碰碰地（像不断撞到东西一样）。

examples.en: He made his way bumpingly through the crowded room, apologizing as he went.
examples.zh: 他在人群中笨拙地挤过去，一边走一边道歉。

extraExplanation: “bumpingly”比较少见；日常更常用的是“bumpily”。两者意思几乎一样，都表示“颠簸地”。
构词上是“bump”（碰撞/颠簸）+ “-ingly”（形成方式副词）。有时为了语气或节奏，作者会选择“bumpingly”而不是更常见的“bumpily”。

summary.en: “Bumpity” is a playful word meaning “bumpy” or “moving with repeated bumps,” often used as the sound “bumpity-bump” in children’s language.
summary.zh: “bumpity”是一个带童趣的说法，表示“很颠簸/凹凸不平”或“颠簸地移动”，也常作拟声用“bumpity-bump”。

definition.en: (Informal, often playful) full of bumps; bumpy.
definition.zh: （非正式、常带玩笑/童趣）颠簸的；凹凸不平的。

examples.en: We drove down a bumpity road, so the coffee spilled a little.
examples.zh: 我们开在一条很颠簸的路上，所以咖啡洒了一点。

examples.en: The old bus ride was bumpity, but everyone laughed about it.
examples.zh: 那趟旧公交车坐起来很颠簸，但大家都笑着说没事。

definition.en: (Playful) with a bumping, jolting motion.
definition.zh: （带童趣）以颠簸、晃动的方式。

examples.en: The cart rolled bumpity down the hill.
examples.zh: 小推车颠颠簸簸地滚下了山。

examples.en: The boat moved bumpity over the small waves.
examples.zh: 小船在小浪上颠簸着前进。

definition.en: A made-up, sound-like word used to imitate repeated bumps, especially in children’s rhymes (often repeated as “bumpity-bump”).
definition.zh: 拟声词/自造词，用来模仿连续的“咚咚”颠簸声，常见于童谣（常重复为“bumpity-bump”）。

examples.en: In the story, the horse went “bumpity-bump” down the path.
examples.zh: 故事里马儿沿着小路“咚咚咚”地跑着。

examples.en: The kid giggled and said, “Bumpity-bump!” when the car hit a pothole.
examples.zh: 车压到坑时，孩子咯咯笑着说：“咚咚咚！”

extraExplanation: “bumpity”更像一种带节奏感的口语/童趣表达，通常用来写声音或感觉（尤其是反复的颠簸）。它不算常见的正式词汇，在日常书面英语里更常用“bumpy”（颠簸的）或“bumpily”（颠簸地）。
在儿童文学或童谣中，作者常用“bumpity-bump”这类重复结构来营造节奏（读起来像鼓点），让画面更生动，也更适合朗读。

summary.en: “Bumpkin” means a country person seen as unsophisticated; it’s often humorous but can be insulting.
summary.zh: “bumpkin”指被认为不够世故的乡下人，常带玩笑或贬义。

definition.en: A person from the countryside who is seen as unsophisticated, ignorant, or awkward (often used humorously or insultingly).
definition.zh: 乡巴佬；土包子（常带幽默或贬义，指不够世故、见识少或举止笨拙的人）。

examples.en: He felt like a bumpkin when he didn’t know how to use the subway ticket machine.
examples.zh: 他不会用地铁售票机时，觉得自己像个乡巴佬。

examples.en: The movie plays with the stereotype of a country bumpkin in the big city.
examples.zh: 这部电影利用了“乡下土包子进大城市”的刻板印象来制造效果。

examples.en: Don’t call her a bumpkin—she’s just new to the city.
examples.zh: 别叫她土包子——她只是刚到城里不熟悉而已。

extraExplanation: “bumpkin”语气通常不太礼貌，常含有嘲笑或轻视的感觉；在日常交流中更安全的说法是“someone from the countryside / a rural person / a small-town person”，或更中性的“not used to city life”。
常见搭配：country bumpkin（典型说法，强调“乡下人”的刻板印象）。在影视与文学里，常用来营造“乡村新人在城市闹笑话”的喜剧冲突。
近义词里：hick、redneck（都可能冒犯；redneck 还常带美国特定阶层/政治文化色彩），yokel（偏贬义但有时更“喜剧化”）。使用时注意场合与对象感受。

summary.en: “Bumpkin” means an unsophisticated rural person; it’s informal and often insulting.
summary.zh: “bumpkin”指被认为不够世故的乡下人，口语且常带贬义。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “bumpkin”) a person from the countryside who is seen as unsophisticated or socially awkward; a “country bumpkin.” (Often informal and can be insulting.)
definition.zh: （很可能你想查的是 bumpkin）乡下人；被认为不够世故、举止笨拙的人（口语，常带贬义）。

examples.en: He felt like a bumpkin at the fancy dinner because he didn’t know which fork to use.
examples.zh: 在那场高级晚宴上，他因为不知道该用哪把叉子而觉得自己像个乡巴佬。

examples.en: Please don’t call people bumpkins—it can sound rude.
examples.zh: 别叫别人“乡巴佬”，这听起来很不礼貌。

examples.en: In the movie, the city kids treat him like a bumpkin at first, but later they become friends.
examples.zh: 电影里，城里的孩子起初把他当成土包子，但后来他们成了朋友。

extraExplanation: “bumpkin”通常用于讽刺或轻视农村出身的人，带有刻板印象；在更礼貌的场合可以用“someone from the countryside / a rural person”。
你输入的“bumpkinet”不是常见英文单词，可能是拼写错误或自造词；如果你想表达“更像/小乡巴佬”的感觉，请告诉我你要用的语境，我可以帮你选更自然的说法。

summary.en: “Bumpkinish” describes someone or something that seems rural, unsophisticated, or socially awkward.
summary.zh: “bumpkinish”形容带乡土气、不够世故、社交上显得笨拙的样子。

definition.en: Like a country bumpkin; awkward, unsophisticated, or rustic in a way that seems socially clumsy.
definition.zh: 像“乡巴佬”一样的；举止笨拙、不够老练、带有土气（常带轻微贬义）。

examples.en: He looked a bit bumpkinish in his oversized suit at the formal dinner.
examples.zh: 在那场正式晚宴上，他穿着过大的西装，看起来有点土气又笨拙。

examples.en: Her bumpkinish jokes didn’t land well in the big-city office.
examples.zh: 她那些有点“乡土味”的玩笑在大城市的办公室里不太奏效。

extraExplanation: “bumpkinish”来源于名词“bumpkin”（乡下土包子、没见过世面的人）加形容词后缀“-ish”（表示“有点像……、带点……的”）。因此语气通常比直接说“bumpkin”更缓和，但仍可能冒犯他人，使用时要注意场合。
在写作里它常用来描绘“社交不熟练、穿着不合时宜、言行有点傻气”的感觉；有时也可带一点幽默或自嘲。

summary.en: “Bumpkinly” means rustic or unsophisticated, like a “bumpkin,” and is often mildly insulting.
summary.zh: “bumpkinly”意为“乡气的、土气笨拙的”，常带轻微贬义。

definition.en: Rustic, awkward, or unsophisticated in a way associated with a country person; like a “bumpkin” (often mildly insulting).
definition.zh: 乡巴佬式的；土气笨拙、不够世故的（常带轻微贬义）。

examples.en: He looked bumpkinly in the fancy restaurant, staring at the many forks and knives.
examples.zh: 在那家高档餐厅里他显得很“乡气”，盯着一堆刀叉不知所措。

examples.en: The movie uses a bumpkinly character for comedy, but it can feel unfair.
examples.zh: 电影用一个“土气”的角色来制造笑点，但这可能让人觉得不太公平。

extraExplanation: “bumpkin”指“乡巴佬、土包子”，所以“bumpkinly”就是“像乡巴佬一样的”。在描述人的举止时，语气通常不太礼貌；如果想更中性，可以用“country”/“rural”/“down-to-earth”（朴实）等词。

summary.en: “Bumpkins” means country people viewed (often unfairly) as unsophisticated; it’s usually insulting.
summary.zh: “bumpkins”指被认为（常不公平地）不够世故的乡下人，通常带侮辱/嘲讽语气。

definition.en: a person from the countryside who is seen as uneducated, unsophisticated, or socially awkward (often used in a rude or mocking way)
definition.zh: （常带贬义/嘲讽）乡下人；土包子；不懂世故的人

examples.en: Some city people unfairly call rural newcomers “bumpkins.”
examples.zh: 有些城里人会不公平地把刚来城市的农村人叫作“bumpkins（土包子）”。

examples.en: He worried his accent would make him sound like a bumpkin.
examples.zh: 他担心自己的口音会让人觉得他像个土包子。

examples.en: The movie plays on the stereotype of bumpkins in the big city.
examples.zh: 这部电影利用了“乡下人进大城市”的刻板印象来制造效果。

extraExplanation: “bumpkin”通常带有轻蔑或取笑的语气，暗含“没见过世面、不够精明”。在正式或尊重的场合不建议用来称呼真实的人。
在现代英语里，描述来自乡村更中性的说法有：“a person from a rural area / a rural resident / someone from the countryside”。
文化上它常与刻板印象相关（如“乡下人到城市出洋相”），在影视作品里多用于喜剧或讽刺。

summary.en: “Bump off” is an informal phrasal verb meaning either to kill someone (slang) or to remove/cancel someone or something from a place or schedule.
summary.zh: “bump off”是非正式短语动词，既可指（俚语）“杀掉某人”，也可指把某人/某事从位置或日程中“挤掉/取消”。

definition.en: (slang) to kill someone, often in a planned or criminal way.
definition.zh: （俚语）杀死某人（常带有预谋或犯罪色彩）。

examples.en: The detective believed the victim was bumped off for his money.
examples.zh: 侦探认为受害者是为了钱被人“做掉”的。

examples.en: It’s a gangster-movie phrase: “They bumped him off last night.”
examples.zh: 这是黑帮电影里常见的说法：“他们昨晚把他做掉了。”

definition.en: (informal) to remove or cancel someone/something (e.g., from a list, schedule, or position), often unexpectedly.
definition.zh: （非正式）把某人/某事从名单、日程或位置上挤掉/取消（常出乎意料）。

examples.en: My meeting got bumped off the schedule by an emergency.
examples.zh: 因为突发状况，我的会议被从日程里挤掉了。

examples.en: The new item bumped the old model off the front page.
examples.zh: 新产品把旧款从首页挤下去了。

extraExplanation: “bump off”多见于美式口语、犯罪小说和黑帮电影语境，语气偏粗俗/黑色幽默；在正式场合建议用更中性的说法，如“kill/murder”或“remove/cancel”。
写法通常是两词：bump off；也可作被动：be bumped off（被杀/被除名）。

summary.en: “Bumpology” is an informal, usually mocking word meaning phrenology—judging people by the bumps on their skull.
summary.zh: “Bumpology”是一个非正式、常带嘲讽的词，指颅相学：用头骨凸起来判断人的性格或能力。

definition.en: (informal, often humorous or critical) The practice of judging a person’s character or abilities by feeling the “bumps” on their skull; phrenology.
definition.zh: （非正式，常带幽默或批评）通过摸头骨上的“凸起”来判断人的性格或能力的做法；即颅相学。

examples.en: The article mocked phrenology as “bumpology,” a fake science from the 1800s.
examples.zh: 那篇文章把颅相学嘲讽为“bumpology”，一种19世纪的伪科学。

examples.en: You can’t choose a leader by bumpology—you need evidence and experience.
examples.zh: 你不能靠“摸头看人”来选领导——你需要证据和经验。

extraExplanation: “Bumpology”由 bump（凸起）+ -ology（……学）构成，语气通常是揶揄：暗示某些看似“有学问”的说法其实缺乏科学依据。
它常用来影射颅相学（phrenology）。颅相学曾在19世纪流行，但后来被证实不可靠，并且在历史上还曾被用来为偏见与歧视寻找“科学”借口；现代语境中使用时要注意其负面历史背景。

summary.en: “Bumps” can mean small raised areas (on skin, objects, or roads), or small difficulties; it can also be the verb form meaning “hits/knocks into” or “moves with jolts.”
summary.zh: “bumps”可指（皮肤/物体/路面上的）小凸起或肿包，也可指小困难、小波折；还可作动词，表示“轻撞/碰到”或“颠簸前行”。

definition.en: Small raised areas, lumps, or swelling on a surface (often on the body or on a road).
definition.zh: （表面上的）小凸起、肿块；（皮肤的）肿起；（道路的）减速带/路面凸起。

examples.en: I hit my head and now I have a bump on my forehead.
examples.zh: 我撞到头了，现在额头上起了个包。

examples.en: Slow down—there are speed bumps ahead.
examples.zh: 慢点——前面有减速带。

examples.en: The table has bumps and scratches from years of use.
examples.zh: 这张桌子因为多年的使用有很多凸起和划痕。

definition.en: Minor problems, difficulties, or unexpected issues in a process or relationship (often in the phrase “bumps in the road”).
definition.zh: （过程/关系中的）小问题、小挫折（常说“bumps in the road”）。

examples.en: Every project has a few bumps along the way.
examples.zh: 每个项目进行途中都会遇到一些小波折。

examples.en: We had some bumps in the road, but we worked them out.
examples.zh: 我们遇到了一些小问题，但都解决了。

definition.en: Third-person singular of “bump”: to hit someone or something lightly; to knock into; to move with small jolts.
definition.zh: “bump”的第三人称单数：轻撞；碰到；（行驶等）颠簸前行。

examples.en: He bumps his knee on the desk when he stands up.
examples.zh: 他站起来时膝盖撞到了桌子。

examples.en: The bus bumps along the old road.
examples.zh: 公交车在旧路上颠簸前行。

examples.en: She bumps into an old friend at the store.
examples.zh: 她在商店里偶遇一位老朋友。

extraExplanation: “bumps into”很常用，既可以表示“无意中撞到”，也常用来表示“偶遇/碰巧遇见”。
“goosebumps”指“鸡皮疙瘩”，通常是因为冷、害怕或感动而起的皮肤小疙瘩：I got goosebumps when I heard the song.（我听到那首歌时起鸡皮疙瘩了。）

summary.en: “Bumpsy” is an informal, playful way to say “bumpy,” meaning uneven or rough; it can also be a rare nickname.
summary.zh: “bumpsy”多为非正式、俏皮的说法，意思接近“bumpy（颠簸的/不平的）”；也可作少见的绰号。

definition.en: (informal) Bumpy; full of bumps; uneven or rough (often used in playful or childlike speech).
definition.zh: （非正式）颠簸的；坑坑洼洼的；不平整的（常带俏皮或幼儿口吻）。

examples.en: The road is really bumpsy after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后这条路真的很颠簸。

examples.en: Hold on—this bus ride is a bit bumpsy.
examples.zh: 抓稳——这趟公交有点颠。

definition.en: (rare) A nickname or name (e.g., “Bumpsy”), usually based on someone’s personality or as a term of endearment.
definition.zh: （少见）绰号或名字（如 “Bumpsy”），多来自性格特点或作为亲昵称呼。

examples.en: Everyone called him Bumpsy when he was a kid.
examples.zh: 他小时候大家都叫他 Bumpsy。

extraExplanation: “bumpsy”在现代英语里并不是标准常用拼写，更常见的是“bumpy”。在口语、儿童用语或可爱风格的表达里，人们可能用“-sy”让词听起来更俏皮（类似“clumsy/ fussy”那种语感）。正式写作建议用“bumpy”。

summary.en: Bumptious describes someone who is rudely self-confident and pushy.
summary.zh: bumptious 用来形容一个人自信过头而显得傲慢、咄咄逼人。

definition.en: Unpleasantly confident and self-important; acting in a pushy, rude way.
definition.zh: 傲慢自大、盛气凌人；以咄咄逼人、无礼的方式表现自信。

examples.en: He was bumptious in meetings, interrupting others to show off his ideas.
examples.zh: 他在会议上很盛气凌人，总打断别人来炫耀自己的想法。

examples.en: The bumptious customer demanded special treatment and spoke to the staff rudely.
examples.zh: 那位傲慢的顾客要求特殊待遇，还对员工很无礼。

extraExplanation: “bumptious”常带有强烈的贬义，强调那种“自以为是 + 爱出风头 + 不尊重他人界限”的态度。比起“confident（自信）”，“bumptious”更接近“pushy/overbearing（咄咄逼人）”。
词源上与“bump（撞、碰）”有关，能帮助理解其画面感：像是一个人“硬挤硬撞”地往前冲，显得粗鲁又自大。
常见近义词：pushy, arrogant, cocky, overbearing。反义倾向：modest, humble, respectful。

summary.en: “Bumptiously” means behaving in a pushy, self-important, often rude way.
summary.zh: “bumptiously”表示以咄咄逼人、自以为是、常带粗鲁的方式行事。

definition.en: In a pushy, self-important, and often rudely confident way.
definition.zh: 以自以为是、爱出风头、常常有点粗鲁的自信方式；冒冒失失又强势地。

examples.en: He bumptiously corrected the teacher in front of the whole class.
examples.zh: 他当着全班的面冒失又自以为是地纠正老师。

examples.en: She walked into the meeting bumptiously, acting like she was in charge.
examples.zh: 她大摇大摆又自以为主导地走进会议室，表现得好像她在掌控全场。

extraExplanation: “bumptiously”来自形容词“bumptious”（冒失又自负的），语气偏负面，常用于批评某人不懂分寸却很爱表现。这个词相对不常见，写作或较正式的叙述中更容易看到。

summary.en: Bumptiousness means annoying, pushy self-confidence—acting overly important.
summary.zh: bumptiousness 指令人反感的自大与盛气凌人：过度自信、爱抢风头，表现得过于重要。

definition.en: The quality of being too self-confident and pushy in a way that annoys other people; acting as if you are more important than you are.
definition.zh: （令人讨厌的）自大、盛气凌人；过度自信并爱出风头，给人以傲慢冒失的感觉。

examples.en: His bumptiousness in meetings made it hard for others to share their ideas.
examples.zh: 他在会议上的盛气凌人让别人很难分享自己的想法。

examples.en: She spoke with such bumptiousness that even simple suggestions sounded like orders.
examples.zh: 她说话特别自大，连简单的建议听起来都像命令。

extraExplanation: 词源上来自形容词 bumptious（自大、爱出风头的）+ 名词后缀 -ness（表示“性质/状态”）。语气通常偏负面，常用来形容缺乏分寸、让人反感的“自信过头”。
易混词：confidence（自信，通常中性/褒义） vs. arrogance（傲慢，偏贬义） vs. bumptiousness（更强调“冒失、爱抢风头、惹人烦”的自大）。

summary.en: Bumpy means not smooth (surface), causing a rough ride/movement, or describing a difficult period that doesn’t go smoothly.
summary.zh: Bumpy 指表面不平；引起颠簸的行程/移动；也可比喻过程坎坷、不顺利。

definition.en: Having many small raised areas; not smooth.
definition.zh: 表面不平的；凹凸不平的。

examples.en: The road is bumpy after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这条路变得很颠簸。

examples.en: This lotion is good for bumpy skin on your arms.
examples.zh: 这款乳液对手臂上粗糙起疙瘩的皮肤很有用。

definition.en: A ride or movement that is rough and jerky because the surface is uneven.
definition.zh: （行程/移动）颠簸的；不平稳的。

examples.en: It was a bumpy flight because of turbulence.
examples.zh: 由于气流颠簸，那趟航班很不平稳。

examples.en: The bus ride home was bumpy but quick.
examples.zh: 回家的公交车一路颠簸，但很快。

definition.en: Difficult and full of problems; not going smoothly.
definition.zh: （经历/过程）坎坷的；不顺利的。

examples.en: They had a bumpy start, but the project succeeded in the end.
examples.zh: 他们开头很不顺，但项目最终成功了。

examples.en: The team has had a bumpy season with many injuries.
examples.zh: 这支队伍这个赛季很坎坷，伤病很多。

extraExplanation: “bumpy”来自“bump”（撞击、凸起），-y 结尾常表示“有……的特征”（如 rainy 多雨的、cloudy 多云的）。所以 bumpy 字面就是“有很多凸起/碰撞感的”。
口语里也常用来形容关系或过程“不顺”：a bumpy relationship（磕磕绊绊的关系）。相比之下，smooth 表示“顺利/平稳”，rough 表示“粗糙/艰难”，bumpy 更强调“一路颠簸、有起伏”。

summary.en: an unsteady flight with shaking caused by turbulence
summary.zh: 因湍流导致摇晃颠簸的飞行/航班

definition.en: A flight with frequent jolts and shaking, usually caused by turbulence (rough air).
definition.zh: 颠簸的航班；通常因气流不稳（湍流）导致飞机摇晃、抖动的飞行过程。

examples.en: It was a bumpy flight, but we landed safely.
examples.zh: 这趟航班很颠簸，但我们安全降落了。

examples.en: The captain warned us about a bumpy flight over the mountains.
examples.zh: 机长提醒我们飞越山区时会比较颠簸。

examples.en: If you’re nervous about a bumpy flight, keep your seatbelt fastened.
examples.zh: 如果你害怕颠簸飞行，请一直系好安全带。

extraExplanation: 在航空语境里，bumpy flight 通常指“有湍流的飞行”。更正式的说法是 turbulence 或 a turbulent flight。
常见机上广播表达：We may experience some turbulence. / Please remain seated with your seatbelt fastened.
etymology: 由形容词 bumpy（“颠簸的”，来自 bump“碰撞、颠一下”）+ 名词 flight（“飞行/航班”）组合而成，口语中常用来描述因湍流导致的不平稳飞行。
mnemonic: 把 bumpy 想成“蹦( bump )一下又一下”，所以 bumpy flight = 飞行中一直“蹦来蹦去”的航班。
联想中文“颠簸”：bump（颠一下）→ bumpy（颠簸的）→ bumpy flight（颠簸的航班）。

summary.en: “Bums” can mean homeless people (often rude), buttocks (slang), or “bums” as a verb meaning scrounges/borrows informally.
summary.zh: “bums”可指（带贬义的）无家可归者、（俚语）屁股，也可作动词表示非正式地讨要/借用/白拿。

definition.en: (plural) people who have no home or job and live by asking for money or help; a rude or informal word for a homeless person.
definition.zh: （复数）无家可归或失业、靠乞讨或他人接济生活的人；对“流浪汉/无家可归者”的粗鲁或很不正式的说法。

examples.en: The city opened a shelter to help homeless people instead of pushing bums out of town.
examples.zh: 这座城市开设了收容所来帮助无家可归者，而不是把所谓的“bums”赶出城。

examples.en: Some people unfairly call anyone sleeping outside “bums.”
examples.zh: 有些人不公平地把所有露宿街头的人都叫作“bums”。

definition.en: (plural, slang) buttocks; the bottom.
definition.zh: （复数，俚语）屁股；臀部。

examples.en: The kids sat down hard and landed on their bums.
examples.zh: 孩子们重重地坐下，摔在屁股上。

examples.en: He fell off the chair and bruised his bum.
examples.zh: 他从椅子上摔下来，把屁股摔青了。

definition.en: (third-person singular, informal) to get something by asking or borrowing, often without paying; to scrounge.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数，非正式）通过讨要或借用来获得（通常不付钱）；白拿；讨来。

examples.en: He always bums cigarettes from his friends.
examples.zh: 他总是向朋友讨烟抽。

examples.en: She bums a ride to work when her car breaks down.
examples.zh: 她车坏了就搭别人的顺风车去上班。

extraExplanation: “bum(s)”指人时在英语里带贬义，可能显得不尊重。更中性、更礼貌的说法是 homeless people / unhoused people（无家可归者）。
“bum a ride / bum a cigarette”属于口语，语气随场景可能是开玩笑、也可能让人觉得你在占便宜；正式场合建议用 borrow / ask for.

summary.en: A vulgar insult meaning someone is being extremely fake and flattering to gain favor (like ‘brown-nosing’).
summary.zh: 一个粗俗的辱骂词，指为了讨好而极度虚伪地奉承（类似“拍马屁/谄媚”）。

definition.en: (vulgar, insulting) Extremely flattering or obedient in a way that seems fake; ‘brown-nosing’ or ‘ass-kissing.’
definition.zh: （粗俗、侮辱性）过度拍马屁、讨好上级，显得很虚伪；相当于“溜须拍马/阿谀奉承/拍马屁”。

examples.en: He got the promotion, and people said it was because he was being bumsucking to the boss.
examples.zh: 他升职了，大家说是因为他对老板太会拍马屁了。

examples.en: Stop the bumsucking and just give your honest opinion.
examples.zh: 别再阿谀奉承了，直接说你的真实看法。

extraExplanation: 这个词带有明显的粗俗身体隐喻（接近“ass-sucking”一类表达），在英语里通常被视为很不礼貌的辱骂用语，最好避免在正式场合、职场、陌生人面前使用。
更常见、相对不粗俗的替代说法有：brown-nosing（拍马屁）、bootlicking（谄媚/舔上级）、sycophantic（书面：谄媚的）。

summary.en: A rare informal noun meaning a trap (literally for a vagrant/thief, or figuratively a trick/pitfall).
summary.zh: 一个少见的非正式名词，指陷阱；可字面指抓流浪汉/小偷的装置，也可比喻“圈套、坑”。

definition.en: (Rare, informal) A trap meant to catch a “bum” (a vagrant) or a petty thief; by extension, any trick or setup meant to catch someone.
definition.zh: （少见，非正式）原指用来抓“流浪汉/小偷”的陷阱；引申为用来套住别人、让人上当的圈套。

examples.en: The old story says the shopkeeper set a bumtrap behind the back door.
examples.zh: 老故事里说，店主在后门后面设了个抓人的陷阱。

examples.en: Watch out—this deal feels like a bumtrap.
examples.zh: 小心——这笔交易感觉像个圈套。

definition.en: (Figurative, rare) An unpleasant surprise or difficult situation that you get “trapped” in.
definition.zh: （比喻，少见）让人陷进去的麻烦处境；令人措手不及的“坑”。

examples.en: I thought it was a simple task, but it turned into a real bumtrap.
examples.zh: 我以为是个简单任务，结果变成了一个大坑。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，多见于较旧的文字或带幽默、讽刺的语境。
词源上就是“bum（流浪汉/懒汉/俗语里也可指屁股）+ trap（陷阱）”。因此有时会带一点粗俗或戏谑色彩，正式写作一般不用。

summary.en: “Bumwood” isn’t a standard English word; it’s likely a misspelling or a proper/local name.
summary.zh: “bumwood”不是标准常用英语词；多半是拼写错误或专有/地方性名称。

definition.en: Not a standard English word in common dictionaries; it is most likely a misspelling, a very local plant/wood name, or a username/proper name.
definition.zh: 不是常见词典里的标准英语词；很可能是拼写错误、非常地方性的植物/木材名称，或用户名/专有名词。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “bumwood” in a dictionary—did you mean “bamboo” or “gumwood”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“bumwood”——你是不是想写“bamboo（竹子）”或“gumwood（某种树/木材名）”？

examples.en: If “Bumwood” is a brand or a place name, please share the sentence where you saw it.
examples.zh: 如果“Bumwood”是品牌名或地名，请把你看到它的句子发我看看。

extraExplanation: “bumwood”看起来像由“bum（流浪汉/懒汉）+ wood（木头）”拼出来的组合，但英语里并没有固定、普遍认可的词义。
最常见的情况是拼写误差：例如“bamboo（竹子）”“gumwood（某些地区对特定树木/木材的叫法）”“deadwood（枯木）”等。把你看到它的上下文句子发来，我可以更准确判断。
